content.1: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
content.3: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.
content.5: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.
content.6: He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways
content.7: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction:
content.9: Thy bow was made quite naked,
content.12: Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.
content.13: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people,
content.14: Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing
content.15: Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses,
content.16: When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.
content.17: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither
content.18: Yet I will rejoice in the
